entry: Convention of the Southeast European Law Enforcement Center (SELEC)
description: note - successor to Southeast European Cooperative Initiative (SECI) formed in 1996 to help the Southeast European countries rebuild and stabilize through access to resources 7 October 2011 to provide support for Member States and enhance coordination in preventing and combating crime in trans-border activity members - (13) Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Greece, Hungary, Moldova, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Romania, Serbia, Slovenia, Turkey operational partners - (2) Italy, USobservers - (15) Austria, Belarus, Belgium, Czechia, France, Georgia, Germany, Israel, Japan, The Netherlands, Slovakia, Spain, Switzerland, Ukraine, UK
